main event: White lights were observed moving erratically over the NW Atlantic on 6 November 1957.
interesting points: Two aircraft witnessed the lights in close proximity., The lights were described as a brilliant flash of blue-white and were brighter than landing lights., The aircraft were at altitudes of 18,200 ft and 19,800 ft., Both aircraft were heading approximately 235 degrees at the time of observation., The event occurred at 2315Z under excellent visibility conditions.
witness description: LCDR Clayton from the US Navy and Major Kelly from the US Air Force.
